definition: wine-lover's heart is not in the cup (idiom); a drinker not really interested in alcohol/having an ulterior motive/to have other things in mind/with an ax to grind/accomplishing something besides what one set out to do
pinyin: zui4 weng1 zhi1 yi4 bu4 zai4 jiu3

definition: intoxicated
elderly man/father/father-in-law/neck feathers of a bird (old)
surname Weng
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
Italy/Italian/abbr. for 意大利[Yi4 da4 li4]
idea/meaning/thought/to think/wish/desire/intention/to expect/to anticipate

sentences.english: It's not the wine but your brain drunk yourself.
sentences.chinese: 醉翁之意不在酒，在乎心腦之間也。

sentences.english: I guessed when he asked for an interview that Smith had an axe to grind.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯要求會見，我想他是醉翁之意不在酒。

definition: lit. Xiang Zhuang performs the sword dance, but his mind is set on Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] (idiom); refers to 206 BC plot to murder Liu Bang, aka Duke of Pei 沛公[Pei4 gong1] and the future Han emperor, during a sword dance at Feast at Hongmen 鴻門宴|鸿门宴[Hong2 men2 Yan4]/an elaborate deception to hide malicious intent
pinyin: Xiang4 Zhuang1 wu3 jian4 , yi4 zai4 Pei4 gong1

definition: to have an axe to grind (idiom)

lit. Xiang Zhuang performs the sword dance, but his mind is set on Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] (idiom, refers to plot to kill Liu Bang during Feast at Hongmen 鴻門宴|鸿门宴[Hong2 men2 Yan4] in 206 BC)/fig. an elaborate deception hiding malicious intent
unspoken implication (idiom)/the actual meaning of what was said
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
